summary: David Marwell was involved with the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB). A memo from John Pereira to David Marwell regards the sensitivity of releasing information about joint US-Mexican telephone tap operations in Mexico City. The documents suggest that Marwell played a role in the ARRB's operations, particularly concerning the review and potential release of sensitive information related to the JFK assassination. He appears to have been a point of contact or recipient of information regarding the sensitivity of certain records, specifically those pertaining to US-Mexican intelligence operations.
key_connections: House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence (HPSCI)
significance: David Marwell's significance in the JFK context lies in his involvement with the ARRB and his role in handling sensitive information related to the assassination records, particularly concerning US-Mexican intelligence operations. He appears to have been a key figure in the process of reviewing and potentially releasing classified information.
